title: IVR-Based Immersive Science Education Course Design

context.prior_knowledge: Basic science education and understanding of pedagogical methodologies
context.additional_context: Enhancing competencies in designing and operating science lessons using IVR technology for pre-service/in-service teachers

learning_goals: Cultivating the ability to design science experiment simulations in IVR-based learning environments

By the end of the 4-week course, learners can apply the three core components of the Immersive Learning Model (ILMU)—learning design, technology integration, and immersion evaluation—to two or more job training scenarios and submit an implementation report meeting at least 80% of expert feedback standards.
Acquiring skills to produce and operate IVR content in a BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) environment

During the 4-week intermediate course, learners can design one science class model using IVR (virtual reality) technology, present development outcomes meeting at least four of five project-based evaluation checklist items, and achieve a combined score of 80+ points from peer and instructor evaluations.

Learners can design three engagement-enhancing strategies for 30-something learners at vocational training institutions using IVR (Immersive Virtual Reality) technology, executable within two weeks, and achieve over 80% satisfaction in peer evaluations and instructor feedback.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
